SENT.plain: The case of a cerebrovascular patient is presented, who at the age of 70 developed unilateral headache, localized in the left orbital region with radiation to the temporo-parietal homolateral region; the attacks lasted 15 to 60 min, presented a chronic temporal pattern from their onset and were accompanied by homolateral lacrimation, conjunctival injection, nasal stuffiness and ptosis of the eyelid
The headache also presented a circadian timing with more frequent occurrence in the evening or early morning h
The possible relevance of cerebrovascular disease with respect to the late onset of the headache is discussed
